name: 程聖倫
objective: This course offers an in-depth introduction to Partial Least Squares Structural Equation Modeling (PLS-SEM), a powerful and flexible technique for analyzing complex relationships among observed and latent variables in applied research. The course is grounded in the use of the SEMinR package in R, providing students with a hands-on, code-based learning experience that emphasizes practical application over mathematical derivation. Throughout the semester, students will develop a strong conceptual and analytical foundation in PLS-SEM, beginning with the distinction between reflective and formative measurement models, and advancing through the evaluation of structural models and the interpretation of model outputs. Particular emphasis will be placed on the following topics: model specification, measurement validation, structural path estimation, bootstrapping for significance testing, predictive relevance assessment, and advanced modeling techniques such as mediation, moderation, and higher-order constructs.
schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to PLS-SEM and Review Hayes's Conditional Process Analysis

Week 2: Getting Started with R, RStudio, and SEMinR

Week 3: Building Basic Path Models in SEMinR

Week 4: Reflective Measurement Models: Specification

Week 5: Reflective Measurement Models: Assessment

Week 6: Formative Measurement Models: Specification

Week 7: Formative Measurement Models: Assessment

Week 8: Structural Model Evaluation

Week 9: Midterm

Week 10: Bootstrapping and Significance Testing

Week 11: Predictive Power and PLSpredict

Week 12: Mediation Analysis

Week 13: Moderation Analysis

Week 14: Moderated Mediation (Conditional Process Modeling)

Week 15: Higher-Order Constructs

Week 16: Multi-Group Analysis and Measurement Invariance

Week 17: Reporting and Visualizing PLS-SEM Results

Week 18: Final
materials:
Course materials will be prepared by the instructor.
